description: From Middle English gamer, attested since before 1450 as a common noun and possibly since 1248 in the name of one Johannes le Gamer. Equivalent to game (noun) +‎ -er (occupational suffix).

entries.meaning: A person who plays any kind of game.
examples: […]  any dice-player, carder, tennis player, or other unlawful gamer.

entries.meaning: A person whose hobby is video games.
examples: That the Parliament congratulates the online gamer, Harry Brewis, who is known by the handle HBomberGuy,  […]

entries.meaning: A person who games the system.

examples: The gamer is farther from restoration even than the drunkard, because what he does he does in the light of sobriety and reason.

entries.meaning: comparative form of game: more game
